summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018, with forwarded emails dating back to 2016, discussing the exchange of case materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes an attorney sharing news articles and legal documents, and coordinating with others to gather information.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: He is the sender of several emails in the chain, forwarding a news article about Epstein in 2016 and attaching legal documents related to cases against Ghislaine Maxwell for review.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: She is added to the email chain by Peter Skinner as one of the lead attorneys on the case, with deep knowledge of the facts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded 2016 news article about his continued relationships with young women and as the subject of the legal cases discussed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in the attached legal documents; a defamation case against her is mentioned, and her motion to dismiss was denied.

connections.description: Skinner adds McCawley to the email chain as a lead attorney on the case, indicating they are working together.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on the case involving Epstein, though the specific client is not explicitly stated.
Implied by the context of shared legal cases and investigations, with Maxwell being a defendant in a related defamation case.

events.title: PageSix reports on Epstein's relationships
events.description: A PageSix article is reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, referencing his East Side mansion.

events.title: Legal update on Maxwell defamation case
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case.

events.title: Email coordination on case materials
events.description: Email exchange about gathering notes, records, and documents from a meeting with Peter Skinner and others relating to Epstein.

keyFacts: In March 2016, media reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, suggesting ongoing activity.
By February 2016, a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell was active, and her motion to dismiss was denied.
Legal documents, including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form, were being exchanged among attorneys in late 2018.
The email chain shows coordination between attorneys (Peter Skinner and Sigrid McCawley) to share information and build their case understanding.
